result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler J Lewein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
IF REVOKED: Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.
No contact with: the business, victim/witness or co-actor in the complaint.

Restitution to be determined - hearing set for 12/07/2016 at 3pm.

AS OF 1/09/2017: Restitution was ordered in the amount of $17,802.03 to LaBelle Company, joint and several with Briana Pacetti, 15CF1368. (along with surcharges)
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - First 4 months STRAIGHT TIME, last 5 months with Huber, STAYED for Agent's discretion if accepted into drug treatment court. Agent will determine huber or straight time.
